page.title: 10A TYPICAL MORNING AT HOME
page.content: Up gets Mark aged 15 at 4.45 a.m. His alarm has buzzed away until it stopped. Movement upstairs as his brother gets clean clothes for the milk round. He pulls on old jeans, T-shirt and pullover. He grabs trainers and takes a quick wash in the bathroom. He goes downstairs, puts on the fire, kettle and radio,then he makes his coffee and smokes a cigarette. At 5.30 he leaves to go to work. When the alarm clock goes again, it's for my dad. He leaves the house at twenty minutes to seven. At seven o-clock my mum goes down in her nightie. She calls out "Sharron" and again. Reluctantly I get up at around 8. By 8.30, brother Richard has gone off with his friend and brother Mark has come home to change. I leave for school and mum locks up.
